question: Select if there is obvious lens distortion (otherwise, leave as Regular):
name: select_if_there_is_obvious_lens_distortion_otherwise_leave_as_regular
group: Video Segment Classification (Camera Settings and Shot compositions)

question: Does this video include any added text or watermarks, such as titles, subtitles, captions, icons, heads-up displays (for video games), or framing elements?
name: are_there_artificially_added_texts_or_watermarks_in_this_video
group: Video Segment Classification (Camera Settings and Shot compositions)

question: Select the video speed:
name: video_speed
group: Video Segment Classification (Camera Settings and Shot compositions)

question: Select the camera point-of-view:
name: select_the_camera_point_of_view
group: Video Segment Classification (Camera Settings and Shot compositions)

question: What is the shot type?
name: what_is_the_shot_type
group: Video Segment Classification (Camera Settings and Shot compositions)

question: Select if the shot is complex:
name: complex_shot_type

options.value: Many Subject(s) with One Clear Focus (subject)
Many Subject(s) with No Clear Focus (scenery)

group: Video Segment Classification (Camera Settings and Shot compositions)

question: If you provide a text description, select the reason:
name: complex_shot_description_reason
group: Video Segment Classification (Camera Settings and Shot compositions)

question: Select the initial shot size:
name: select_shot_size_at_start_of_video

options.value: N/A (e.g., no subject / too many subjects)
Medium Close-up shot (Human Subject Shot Only)

group: Video Segment Classification (Camera Settings and Shot compositions)

question: Select the ending shot size:
name: select_shot_size_at_end_of_video

options.value: N/A (e.g., no subject / too many subjects)
Medium Close-up shot (Human Subject Shot Only)

default: N/A (e.g., no subject / too many subjects)
group: Video Segment Classification (Camera Settings and Shot compositions)

question: Describe complex shot size in the text box below:
name: shot_size_text_box
group: Video Segment Classification (Camera Settings and Shot compositions)

question: Select the initial camera height relative to the subject(s):
name: select_camera_height_relative_to_subject_at_start

options.value: N/A (e.g., no subject or too complex)

group: Video Segment Classification (Camera Settings and Shot compositions)

question: Select the ending camera height relative to the subject(s):
name: select_camera_height_relative_to_subject_at_end
group: Video Segment Classification (Camera Settings and Shot compositions)

question: Describe complex relative camera height in the text box below:
name: relative_camera_height_text_box
group: Video Segment Classification (Camera Settings and Shot compositions)

question: Select the initial overall camera height:
name: select_overall_camera_height_at_start
group: Video Segment Classification (Camera Settings and Shot compositions)

question: Select the ending overall camera height:
name: select_overall_camera_height_at_end
group: Video Segment Classification (Camera Settings and Shot compositions)

question: Describe complex overall camera height in the text box below:
name: overall_camera_height_text_box
group: Video Segment Classification (Camera Settings and Shot compositions)

question: Select the initial camera angle:
name: select_camera_angle_at_start

options.value: High angle (e.g., looking down at the subject)
Low angle (e.g., looking up at the subject)

group: Video Segment Classification (Camera Settings and Shot compositions)

question: Select the ending camera angle:
name: select_camera_angle_at_end

options.value: High angle (e.g., looking down at the subject)
Low angle (e.g., looking up at the subject)

group: Video Segment Classification (Camera Settings and Shot compositions)

question: Describe complex camera angle in the text box below:
name: camera_angle_text_box
group: Video Segment Classification (Camera Settings and Shot compositions)

question: Is there an obvious Dutch (canted) angle (>15 degrees) throughout the video?
name: is_there_dutch_angle
group: Video Segment Classification (Camera Settings and Shot compositions)

question: Select the type of camera focus:
name: select_type_of_camera_focus
group: Video Segment Classification (Camera Settings and Shot compositions)

question: Select the depth of camera focus (start of video):
name: select_depth_of_camera_focus_at_start
group: Video Segment Classification (Camera Settings and Shot compositions)

question: Select the depth of camera focus (end of video):
name: select_depth_of_camera_focus_at_end

question: If the focus plane changes, is it due to:
name: focus_plane_change_reason
group: Video Segment Classification (Camera Settings and Shot compositions)

question: Describe complex camera focus in the text box below:
name: camera_focus_text_box
group: Video Segment Classification (Camera Settings and Shot compositions)

question: Select the camera steadiness:
name: select_the_camera_steadiness

options.value: Very Smooth / No Shaking (e.g., Drone shot with no shaking at all)
Smooth / Minimal Shaking (e.g., Steadicam shot or stabilized handheld shot)
Very Unsteady (e.g., Extreme shaky shot, found footage style)

question: Is there camera movement (other than camera shaking)?
name: is_there_camera_movement

question: How fast is the camera motion (e.g., crash zoom, whip pan)?
name: how_fast_is_the_camera_motion

question: Is the camera tracking (following) the moving subject(s)?
name: is_the_camera_tracking

question: Select the type(s) of tracking shot:
name: select_the_types_of_tracking_shot

options.value: Aerial (tracking from above, usually with a drone or crane)

question: Does the size of the subject change?
name: does_the_size_of_subject_change

name: is_the_camera_moving_forward_or_backward

name: is_the_camera_zooming

name: is_the_camera_trucking_left_or_right

name: is_the_camera_moving_up_or_down

name: is_the_camera_rolling

name: describe_complex_camera_motion
